availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John W. Neville (marion co KY, barkeeper and capt. 1st Ky Light Artillery)

body.p: Marion County, Kentucky, barkeeper and soldier. Virginia native. Married to Isabella Coyle Neville in Woodford County, Kentucky, in 1856. Father of John William Neville Jr., Lillian Neville, Emma Neville, and Isabella Neville. Barkeeper in Marion County in 1860. Served in the 1st Kentucky Light Artillery Regiment (U.S.A.) as second lieutenant and captain from September 10, 1863, to November 14, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, Lebanon, p. 549.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Indiana, Floyd County, New Albany, p. 236B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Woodford County Marriages, Film #000252333, p. 31 of 464 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 509.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0148.
